Cinematography.description: Discover objects tracing the technological development of motion pictures, both professional and amateur. Explore significant items from pre-cinema optical toys and film pioneer Louis Le Prince's cameras to contemporary technologies.

Photographic Technology.description: Delve into the story of photography's invention, from its myriad formats and processes to apparatus from decades of technological development. As well as cameras, browse stereoscopes, lenses, shutters, darkroom equipment and more.

Photographs.description: Our collection of photographs brings to light over a century of photography produced by both professionals and amateurs. Explore photography as an artistic practice as well as a valuable tool in medicine, experimental science and industry.

Locomotives and Rolling Stock.description: From record-breaking Mallard to experimental engines and a Japanese bullet train, discover significant rail engines and vehicles which tell the story of the railways in Britain and around the world.

Railway Posters, Notices & Handbills.description: Our railway posters, featuring the work of many well-known artists, advertise both the railways themselves and the destinations they served offer a fascinating record of railway style and graphic design.

Classical & Medieval Medicine.description: Belonging to one of the most significant medical collections in the world, the earliest objects date from antiquity, offering unique insights into early ideas about health and medicine.

Radio Communication.description: Discover the technological development of wireless telegraphy through objects relating to the history of radio, and television transmission and reception.

Telecommunications.title: Telecommunications
Telecommunications.description: Explore objects reflecting major developments in how we communicate, including the BT Connected Earth collection, which comprises a wide range of telecommunications equipment.

Art.title: Art
Art.description: Take a look at how both artists and scientists make scientific activity visual and shape how we see science. Our artworks range across painting, drawing, print and sculpture from the 1500s to today.

Computing & Data Processing.description: From slide rules to Douglas Hartree's differential analyser and Ferranti's early computers, these objects trace the development of calculating and computing technology.

Textile Industry.description: Machinery and other objects - from carding engines and looms to printing blocks and fabric specimens - tell the story of Britain's role in textile manufacturing from the Industrial Revolution onwards.
